childElements.name: HREESI_Disability
HREESI_DisabilityText
childElements.propertySetConfig: { "controlWidth" : 12.0, "label" : "The Accessible Canada Act defines disability as “any impairment, including a physical, mental, intellectual, cognitive, learning, communication or sensory impairment—or a functional limitation—whether permanent, temporary or episodic in nature, or evident or not, that, in interaction with a barrier, hinders a person’s full and equal participation in society.”", "text" : "The Accessible Canada Act defines disability as “any impairment, including a physical, mental, intellectual, cognitive, learning, communication or sensory impairment—or a functional limitation—whether permanent, temporary or episodic in nature, or evident or not, that, in interaction with a barrier, hinders a person’s full and equal participation in society.”", "show" : null, "dataJSON" : false, "HTMLTemplateId" : "", "textKey" : "", "sanitize" : false }

childElements.name: HREESI_PrivacyText1
childElements.propertySetConfig:
{ "controlWidth" : 12.0, "label" : "The purpose of the self-identification form is to collect information so the agencies can monitor the\nequity performance of programs and design new measures that achieve greater equity, diversity and\ninclusion in the research enterprise. The Canada Research Chairs Program also uses the data to help\ninstitutions meet their equity and diversity targets.", "text" : "The purpose of the self-identification form is to collect information so the agencies can monitor the
equity performance of programs and design new measures that achieve greater equity, diversity and
inclusion in the research enterprise. The Canada Research Chairs Program also uses the data to help
institutions meet their equity and diversity targets.", "show" : null, "dataJSON" : false, "HTMLTemplateId" : "", "textKey" : "", "sanitize" : false }

childElements.name: HREESI_PrivacyText2
childElements.propertySetConfig:
{ "controlWidth" : 12.0, "label" : "The personal information is collected under the respective authority of section 4(2)(a) of the Natural\nSciences and Engineering Research Council Act, section 4(2)(a) of the Social Sciences and Humanities\nResearch Council Act, or sections 4, 5 and 26 of the Canadian Institutes of Health Research Act,\ndepending on the program.", "text" : "The personal information is collected under the respective authority of section 4(2)(a) of the Natural
Sciences and Engineering Research Council Act, section 4(2)(a) of the Social Sciences and Humanities
Research Council Act, or sections 4, 5 and 26 of the Canadian Institutes of Health Research Act,
depending on the program.", "show" : null, "dataJSON" : false, "HTMLTemplateId" : "", "textKey" : "", "sanitize" : false }

childElements.name: HREESI_PrivacyText3
childElements.propertySetConfig:
{ "controlWidth" : 12.0, "label" : "Your data will be collected, used, disclosed and retained in accordance with the Privacy Act. It may be\nused for the purposes of program operations(including recruitment for merit review processes, where\napplicable), planning, performance measurement and monitoring, evaluation, and audits, and in\naggregate form to report to government or to the public. Self-identification statistics will always be\nreported in aggregate form, to ensure protection of the identity of any individual.", "text" : "Your data will be collected, used, disclosed and retained in accordance with the Privacy Act. It may be
used for the purposes of program operations(including recruitment for merit review processes, where
applicable), planning, performance measurement and monitoring, evaluation, and audits, and in
aggregate form to report to government or to the public. Self-identification statistics will always be
reported in aggregate form, to ensure protection of the identity of any individual.", "show" : null, "dataJSON" : false, "HTMLTemplateId" : "", "textKey" : "", "sanitize" : false }

childElements.name: HREESI_PrivacyText4
childElements.propertySetConfig:
{ "controlWidth" : 12.0, "label" : "The Tri-agency Institutional Programs Secretariat (TIPS) also shares aggregated self-identification data\nwith host institutions to allow them to monitor their efforts in meeting their equity targets for the\nCanada Research Chairs Program. While TIPS never sharesself-identification data specific to an\nindividual, it is possible that some institutions may be able to identify some individuals' personal\ninformation when the aggregated data shared isfor fewer than five chairholders. TIPS shares data\nwith only one key administrative contact per institution, identified by the institution as having the\nauthority to receive the data, under very strict confidentiality requirements. No data on sexual\norientation nor the subcategories of visible minority group and persons with disabilities is shared with\ninstitutions.", "text" : "The Tri-agency Institutional Programs Secretariat (TIPS) also shares aggregated self-identification data
with host institutions to allow them to monitor their efforts in meeting their equity targets for the
Canada Research Chairs Program. While TIPS never sharesself-identification data specific to an
individual, it is possible that some institutions may be able to identify some individuals' personal
information when the aggregated data shared isfor fewer than five chairholders. TIPS shares data
with only one key administrative contact per institution, identified by the institution as having the
authority to receive the data, under very strict confidentiality requirements. No data on sexual
orientation nor the subcategories of visible minority group and persons with disabilities is shared with
institutions.", "show" : null, "dataJSON" : false, "HTMLTemplateId" : "", "textKey" : "", "sanitize" : false }

childElements.name: HREESI_PrivacyText5
childElements.propertySetConfig:
{ "controlWidth" : 12.0, "label" : "For more information, please refer to the relevant agency's Personal Information Banks:\n
NSERC: PSU 941 and PSU 942, described in NSERC's Info Source.\n
SSHRC: PSU 941, PSU 942 and PPU 055, described in SSHRC's Info Source. The Personal Information\n
Bank for the New Frontiers in Research Fund is in development.\n
CIHR: PSU 941 and PSU 942, as described in CIHR's Info Source.", "text" : "For more information, please refer to the relevant agency's Personal Information Banks:

NSERC: PSU 941 and PSU 942, described in NSERC's Info Source.

SSHRC: PSU 941, PSU 942 and PPU 055, described in SSHRC's Info Source. The Personal Information

Bank for the New Frontiers in Research Fund is in development.

CIHR: PSU 941 and PSU 942, as described in CIHR's Info Source.", "show" : null, "dataJSON" : false, "HTMLTemplateId" : "", "textKey" : "", "sanitize" : false }

childElements.name: HREESI_PrivacyText6
childElements.propertySetConfig:
{ "controlWidth" : 12.0, "label" : "All applicationsfor funding require you to complete a self-identification form; however, if you would\nprefer not to self-identify and/or provide the requested information, you may select “I prefer not to\nanswer\" for any or all of the questions. Canada Research Chairs Program nominees must complete a\nself-identification form as an application requirement. Where the nominating institution has not met\nits equity targets, the program restricts nominationsto nominees who have self-identified as a\nmember of one or more of the four designated groups (women, persons with disabilities, Indigenous\npeoples and members of visible minorities). Where the nominating institution has met its equity\ntargets, there are no such restrictions.", "text" : "All applicationsfor funding require you to complete a self-identification form; however, if you would
prefer not to self-identify and/or provide the requested information, you may select “I prefer not to
answer\" for any or all of the questions. Canada Research Chairs Program nominees must complete a
self-identification form as an application requirement. Where the nominating institution has not met
its equity targets, the program restricts nominationsto nominees who have self-identified as a
member of one or more of the four designated groups (women, persons with disabilities, Indigenous
peoples and members of visible minorities). Where the nominating institution has met its equity
targets, there are no such restrictions.", "show" : null, "dataJSON" : false, "HTMLTemplateId" : "", "textKey" : "", "sanitize" : false }

childElements.name: HREESI_PrivacyText7
childElements.propertySetConfig:
{ "controlWidth" : 12.0, "label" : "For more information about your rights under the Privacy Act, or our privacy practices, or to access or\ncorrect your personal information, please contact the relevant agency's access to information and\nprivacy (ATIP) office:\n
· NSERC's ATIP Coordinator\n
· SSHRC's(and TIPS') ATIP Coordinator\n
· CIHR's ATIP Coordinator", "text" : "For more information about your rights under the Privacy Act, or our privacy practices, or to access or
correct your personal information, please contact the relevant agency's access to information and
privacy (ATIP) office:

· NSERC's ATIP Coordinator

· SSHRC's(and TIPS') ATIP Coordinator

· CIHR's ATIP Coordinator", "show" : null, "dataJSON" : false, "HTMLTemplateId" : "", "textKey" : "", "sanitize" : false }
